answers.answer: Also I have been to the Dr. about this and tested negative for urinary tract infection.

Hi there!Well, without a detailed clinical evaluation it would be difficult to determine the cause of your symptoms. Excessive fluid intake and GU infections, increased urinary frequency could be related to GU inflammations, growths/ masses, neuro-muscular causes, hormonal/ endocrine issues, diabetes etc. I would suggest getting this evaluated by an internist initially and depending on the cause diagnosed/ suspected, it can be managed accordingly or specialist care may be sought.Hope this is helpful.Take care!

question: I often have to urinate 4 to 6 times per night. I am not drinking a tremendous amount of fluids right before bed. The amount of each void during the night is significant. Not small amounts. I drink only water on a daily basis.  What might my problem. And solution be?
title: Urinating 4 to six times per night
